items.label: List all packages in PACKAGES fileref

children.label: Generate a result dataset in the WORK directory

children.text: ℹ️ Includes a list of SAS packages in the PACKAGES fileref

children.label: Used only to add an input port for connecting nodes

children.text:
This step returns information about a SAS package or the SAS packages currently available in the PACKAGES fileref. Results are printed to the Results window or can be optionally redirected to the log.

ℹ️ The SAS Packages Framework must be initialized before running this step. This step is supported if the SAS Packages Framework is initialized with code.

children.label: Display help for a SAS package

children.text:
Displays built-in help information about a package provided by the developer.

ℹ️ Packages stored in SAS Content are copied to the WORK directory before displaying help. If the checksum of the package in SAS Content is different from the checksum of the package in WORK, or if the package is not in WORK, the package is copied automatically.

You can optionally type in a keyword to search and filter. For example, "license" will print the license, while "*" will print all help.

Generating a result dataset will create a dataset in WORK named PACKAGENAME_CONTENT that contains information about the package content.

The following options correspond to each parameter of %helpPackage:

• Keyword to search: helpKeyword
• Generate a result dataset in the WORK directory: packageContentDS

For more information about these options, see SAS Package Framework documentation:
https://github.com/yabwon/SAS_PACKAGES/blob/main/SPF/SPFinit.md#helppackage

Displays built-in help information about a package provided by the developer.

ℹ️ Packages stored in SAS Content are copied to the WORK directory before previewing. If the checksum of the package in SAS Content is different from the checksum of the package in WORK, or if the package is not in WORK, the package is copied automatically.

You can optionally type in a keyword to search and filter. For example, "license" will print the license, while "*" will print all help.

The available option for Preview corresponds to the below argument in %previewPackage:

• Keyword to search: helpKeyword

For more information about this option, see SAS Package Framework documentation:
https://github.com/yabwon/SAS_PACKAGES/blob/main/SPF/SPFinit.md#previewPackage

children.label: List all packages in the PACKAGES fileref

children.text:
This option lists all packages available in the PACKAGES fileref, including additional information about each package. 

⚠️ Packages stored in SAS Content are not supported. The PACKAGES fileref always points to a physical location. If you have initialized the SAS Packages Framework with the Initialize step and chose to store packages in SAS Content, the packages listed by this step are only those currently in the WORK directory.

Generating a result dataset creates a dataset in WORK named SPF_PACKAGE_LIST that contains a list of packages in the PACKAGES fileref.

The available option for List corresponds to the below argument in %listPackages:

• Generate a result dataset in the WORK directory: listDataSet
